goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Age: 18 years and over. Discrimination grounds (6): sex (gender), race/ethnic group, regional origin (province, region), disability, religion, poverty or wealth.
sources: National Statistical Office - EnquĂŞte sur les conditions de vies des mĂŠnages

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 5 years. Age: 15 years and over. Discrimination grounds (10): sex, age, physical/mental disability, ethnicity/culture and race/colour and language (each of which are collected as separate items), religion, sexual orientation, other reason (includes physical appearance).\n
sources: National Statistical Office - General Social Survey on Victimization

footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 5 years. Age: 15 years and over. Discrimination grounds (10): sex, age, physical/mental disability, ethnicity/culture and race/colour and language (each of which are collected as separate items), religion, sexual orientation, other reason (includes physical appearance).\n
sources: National Statistical Office - General Social Survey on Victimization

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Population: covers occupying private dwellings on 324 of the 345 municipalities, covering all the major administrative territorial regions. Age: 18 years and over. Discrimination grounds (10): socio-economic level, gender, marital status, being a foreigner, age, sexual orientation, religion, the place where he/she lives, belonging to an indigenous group, disability.
sources: National Statistical Office - Encuesta de CaracterizaciĂłn Socio EconĂłmica Nacional

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 15-49 years. Sample size: 21756 women and 6113 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - EnquĂŞte par grappes Ă indicateurs multiples avec volet paludisme (MICS6-PALU)

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Discrimination grounds (8): sex, age, ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, other reason.
sources: National Statistical Office - Encuesta de Mujeres, NiĂąez y Adolescencia/MICS6

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Definition: refers to those that describe themselves as a member of a group that is discriminated against. Age: 15 years and over. Sample size: 1502 people residing in Denmark. Discrimination grounds (10): skin colour or race, nationality, religion, language, ethnic group, age, gender, sexuality, disability, other.
sources: National Statistical Office - European Social Survey

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Age: 14-75 years. Sample size: 20000 to 25000 "ordinary" households - i.e. excluding households living in collective housing (hostels, prisons, hospitals, etc.) and living in mobile homes (bargemen, homeless people, etc.). Geographical area: metropolitan France. Discrimination grounds (12): skin colour, origin (or supposed origins), religion (or supposed religion), sexual orientation or identity (or supposed sexual orientation), the fact of being a man / a woman, age (young / senior), neighbourhood or place of residence, handicap/state of health, membership/union/political opinion, state of pregnancy, physical appearance, other.
sources: National Statistical Office - Living Environment and Security Survey

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 6812 women and 2697 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 6812 women and 2697 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 6812 women and 2697 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18 years and over. Sample size: 13866 households were reached at the total level and 11602 households responded. Discrimination grounds (8): sex, age, disability, religion, socio-economic status, race (skin colour), place of residence, political / intellectual / family affiliation.
sources: National Statistical Office - Rule of Law and Access to Justice Survey

footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18 years and over. Sample size: 13866 households were reached at the total level and 11602 households responded. Discrimination grounds (8): sex, age, disability, religion, socio-economic status, race (skin colour), place of residence, political / intellectual / family affiliation.
sources: National Statistical Office - Rule of Law and Access to Justice Survey

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 15-49 years. Sample size: 4150 women and 2083 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Social Development Indicator Survey (MICS6)

footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 4150 women and 2083 men. Discrimination grounds (7): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Social Development Indicator Survey (MICS6)

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers to occurrences in his/her life instead of the last 5 years and last 12 months. Population: Living in private households. Age: 15-64 years. Sample size: 18749 women and 17824 men. Discrimination grounds (7): origin (nationality, citizenship), educational attainment, health state, gender, age, family circumstances (e.g. kid, elderly care, patient care), other reason.
sources: National Statistical Office - Labour Force Survey

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers to occurrences in his/her life instead of the last 5 years and last 12 months. Population: Living in private households. Age: 15-64 years. Sample size: 18749 women and 17824 men. Discrimination grounds (7): origin (nationality, citizenship), educational attainment, health state, gender, age, family circumstances (e.g. kid, elderly care, patient care), other reason.
sources: National Statistical Office - Labour Force Survey

footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 30660 women. Discrimination grounds (5): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, other reason.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: [2014]: ["Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 2 years. Age: 18 years and over. Reference period: Q3 2014. Sample size: 5885 men and 8983 women. Discrimination grounds (10): gender, civil or marital status, family status, age, disability, race/skin colour/ethnic group/nationality, other (includes categories 'sexual orientation', 'religious belief', 'membership of the traveller community' and 'other')."] // [2019]: ["Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 2 years. Age: 18 years and over. Reference period: Q1 2019. Sample size: 1848 men and 2123 women. Discrimination grounds (10): gender, civil or marital status, family status (examples include pregnancy or with children or other dependants), age, disability, race/skin colour/ethnic group/nationality, sexual orientation, other (includes categories 'religious belief', 'membership of the traveller community' and 'other')."]
sources: [2014]: National Statistical Office - Quarterly National Household Survey // [2019]: National Statistical Office - Labour Force Survey

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Population: in private dwellings in the North Island, South Island, or Waiheke Island of New Zealand. Age: 15 years and over (the sexual/gender identity ground and disaggregation cover only 18 years and over). Sample size: approximately 12000 households. Discrimination grounds (10): sex, age, skin colour and race/ethnic group and accent/language spoken (each of which are collected as separate items), sexual identity and gender identity, religious beliefs, disability or health status, any other reason (includes way of dress or appearance).
sources: National Statistical Office - General Social Survey

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 10129 women and 4178 men. Discrimination grounds (10): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy (only asked to women), political affiliation, born out of wedlock, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 15-49 years. Sample size: 10129 women and 4178 men. Discrimination grounds (10): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy (only asked to women), political affiliation, born out of wedlock, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 7000 women and 2828 men. Discrimination grounds (8): sex, age, ethnic origin, disability, religion or belief, immigration origin, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 5 years. Age: 15-88 years. Sample size: 3000 persons. Discrimination grounds (15): Age, sex/gender, sexual orientation, citizenship (foreign), citizenship (Swiss), ethnicity, religion, skin colour/other physical characteristics, language/dialect/accent, social position (e.g. rich, poor), professional status (e.g. labourer, employee), political orientation/differing opinions, disability, belonging to another group, no grounds. Data collection: data on discrimination and harassment are collected separately.
sources: National Statistical Office - Survey on Diversity and Coexistence

goal_descEN: Reduce inequality within and among countries
target_descEN: Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard
indicator_descEN: Proportion of population reporting having personally felt discriminated against or harassed in the previous 12 months on the basis of a ground of discrimination prohibited under international human rights law
seriesDescription: Proportion of population reporting having felt discriminated against, by grounds of discrimination, sex and disability (%)
footnotes: Time period: refers only to occurrences in the last 12 months. Age: 18-49 years. Sample size: 10559 women and 2445 men. Discrimination grounds (6): sex, age, ethnic or immigration origin, disability, sexual orientation, other reason. Estimates: the aggregated data for both sexes are an indirect estimation from data for women and men.
sources: National Statistical Office - Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS6)
